title: UI / Front End Developer
description:
9Shot Golf Innovations is looking for a talented UI / Front End Developer to play a key role in bringing awesome products to life. We're now building an online lesson platform that will revolutionize the way people learn golf. Come develop responsive/elegant UI applications with the latest technologies and be part of a fun loving, hard working team!

RESPONSIBILITIES:

• Work closely with the UX and dev teams to improve existing features, and build new ones.
• Expanding your knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies, and software development best practices.
• Assisting in the development of tools and utilities to fulfill the company’s operational and organizational needs.
• Organize and prioritize tasks with regards to project deadlines.
• Maintain existing client sites by troubleshooting changes, updates and bug fixes.
• Passion for the quality of work you produce, and you're self-motivated to spot ways to improve it.

SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS:

The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic, flexible, and have a strong customer service ethic. A developer at heart, you are able to code highly usable front ends, and you also have immense respect for end-user experience and pixel perfection.

• You live and breathe CSS & HTML and love the challenge of writing efficient, responsive and semantic markup. Did we mention responsive?
• 3+ years of experience in front-end development
• You are well versed with the ins and outs of Sass or Less preprocessors (we use Sass at 9Shot).
• You can take initiative and able to create new approaches to problems.
• You have a natural eye for minimal design and good composition, and you obsess about details, interactions, and delighting users.
• You are likable and fun to be around.

Nice to have:

• You have hands-on experience with client-side Javascript frameworks like Angular, Ember or Backbone.
• You have experience with common back-end frameworks (eg Yii, Symfony, PHP/Zend or others).
• You have User experience (UX) skills and experience.
• Portfolio of relevant work.
• Contributions to the online community through sites like Dribbble, CodePen, GitHub, etc

title: Digital Designer
description: The Unbounce Creative team is looking for a digital designer. This is a creative role that focuses on crafting compelling interactive experiences, with an occasional pivot towards motion design. We are looking for a designer that loves to tell a story in the digital world.

title: Product Owner
description:
About the Role

The Product Owner will work with us in our Vancouver office and will require a solid understanding of our users, the market place, the competition and of future trends and needs for those living in multi-dwelling communities. 

The right candidate will be high energy, detail-oriented and passionate about the real estate and technology sector.  You are resourceful, able to lead and can manage multiple projects at once. 

This position reports to the VP of Product and works closely with the Marketing, Sales, Customer Success and Development teams. We have a great work environment that is collaborative, innovative, empowering, and fun. Everyone on our team drives stellar results and we expect the same from you.

About You

You should be highly creative, have a bias for action, and have mastered the art of breaking a complex product vision down into executable steps. You're a brilliant consensus builder who can effectively and efficiently articulate product vision, purpose, and focus. You know how to motivate people. Part data nerd, part realist, you are obsessed with measurement, and diligent about answering the hard questions: are really using your products? How are they using them?

You have a proud history of shipping, and understand how to balance perfection against an agreed upon delivery date. You are an empathic advocate for your users and champion a listen-first-ask-question-sooner approach to improving your products. 

Above all else, you love asking "WHY?"

Responsibilities: 

Part of the Product Owner responsibilities is to understand and help shape the vision of what is to be built, and convey that vision to the development team through the product backlog and a prioritized list of features for the product.

●  Lead requirements gathering on User Stories and review with development

●  Write User Stories for Epics and review with development

●  Attend development meetings, including scrum meetings, daily standups, retrospectives, demos and others as required.

●  Lead backlog grooming

●  Create mockups working with UX on design

●  Respond to questions from development to clarify requirements

●  Document new features for implementation and release notes

●  Write user acceptance criteria working with development

●  Demonstrate new product functionality to customers (pre-release) and other stakeholders to gather feedback

●  Support marketing and sales with automation tools

. 
Qualifications: 

The Product Owner role requires an individual with business savvy and communication skills. The Product Owner needs to be actively engaged with their teams and show commitment to do whatever is necessary to build the best product possible.

●  5 years of experience working in product and delivering exception results

●  5 years of business analysis experience

●  Excellent communication skills both verbal and written

●  Great organizational, self-management, and problem solving skills

●  Flexibility for scheduling based on business needs

●  Must be willing and able to travel as required

 

Visit mybazinga.com for more info.

This is a full-time position based at our office in Vancouver, Canada. Naturally, compensation is competitive and attractive based on level of experience. Comprehensive benefits package included.

Please email your credentials to hr@mybazinga.com by November 7, 2014.

Let’s make something amazing.

title: Digital Marketing Manager
description:
Company Overview

Recon Instruments is the world leader in smartglass technology for sports and high intensity environments. Founded in 2008, Recon’s award winning multi-patent and patent-pending technology platforms integrate a Heads-up Display (HUD) with a state-of-the-art micro-computer and sensor suite that provide performance information, navigation, and more, direct-to-eye, in real-time. With worldwide distribution and partnerships with leading technology and optics companies, Recon continues to define and evolve the HUD category. 

 

Position Overview

We’re looking to expand our exciting and innovative team with a Digital Marketing Manager. This highly valuable role gives you the opportunity to build and expand upon your extensive knowledge of web marketing and digital campaigns. Including deep knowledge and experience with social media advertising placements, targeting, re-targeting, ROI optimization, funnel management, SEO optimization, social media, community building, and CRM Management to help improve strategies and hit company-wide goals.

Our ideal candidate knows the digital marketing landscape like the back of their hand and will be a high impact contributor at both strategic and tactical levels.  This role will be highly influential in day-to-day decision making within the marketing and sales team.

Reporting to the Chief Marketing Officer, the Digital Marketing Manager is responsible for defining, implementing and analyzing web marketing campaigns to hit targets and company-wide initiatives. The Digital Marketing manager is also expected to make recommendations on how to improve strategies and campaigns based on his or her analysis.  

 

Primary Responsibilities:

Develop and execute an integrated digital marketing strategy across all digital channels.
Analyze funnel traffic and recommend new business rules for marketing campaigns based on analysis and knowledge of the customer base and its behaviour.
Manage and personally execute all aspects of Recon’s paid search, display advertising, and social media advertising programs.
Develop, lead, and monitor SEO optimization plan and metrics to continually improve ongoing campaigns.
Work closely with web development and design teams on website and email communication improvements, such as newly designed pages, url structure, new email templates, etc.
Analyze a variety of data such as: customer behavior, web analytics, online marketing, direct marketing and market research.
Support future direct marketing efforts by leveraging customer and brand insights to help design future lifecycle and triggered campaigns.
Stay on top of current trends in online marketing, best practices, and test new offerings/technologies.
Collaborate intensely with CMO, product leadership, customer service, and sales leadership to optimize coordination and ensure we are applying resources against the most high value business priorities.
 

Skills and Qualifications:

5+ years of web marketing experience, with 3+ years experience in online advertising, search marketing, and landing page optimization.
Bachelor’s degree with a specialty in Marketing, Economics, or a field with a quantitative focus; MBA preferred.
Proven ability to effectively implement SEO best practices.
Strong working-knowledge of current web technologies and services including: Facebook Platform and Google APIs.
Experienced analytics and reporting tools user (Brownie points if you're a Google Analytics Guru).
Advanced experience using and managing campaigns with CRM's.
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills.
Must have an entrepreneurial spirit and be able to grow social accounts and web traffic with minimal spend.
Proven thought leader in the digital landscape – you eat, sleep and breathe what’s trending.
Enormously flexible and adaptable to rapidly changing business conditions and priorities.
 

Life at Recon

We brainstorm, design and prototype customer-focused products. At Recon our four core values are important to us. That's why we Create with Passion, Drive to Deliver, Wow the Customer, and Play as a Team.

Life at Recon means working with awesome technology in small teams with friendly people who are passionate about their craft. We also provide ways to let go and have fun because we believe people who enjoy their workplace create great things together.  

So, what does fun look like to us? Ping-pong and foosball matches, Friday dinners, weekly happy hour, group bike rides, and company-wide events. At Recon, we care about our teams and fully embrace the west coast work-hard, play-hard mentality.

title: Product Manager
description:
Company Overview

Recon Instruments is the world leader in smartglass technology for sports and high intensity environments. Founded in 2008, Recon’s award winning multi-patent and patent-pending technology platforms integrate a Heads-up Display (HUD) with a state-of-the-art micro-computer and sensor suite that provide performance information, navigation, and more, direct-to-eye, in real-time. With worldwide distribution and partnerships with leading technology and optics companies, Recon continues to define and evolve the HUD category. 

 

Position Overview

We are looking for an experienced Product Manager to work with Recon’s mobile, web, and platform development teams to help build the next generation of our Engage platform across heads-up display, web, and mobile devices. Reporting to the Director of Consumer Products, the Product Manager will be responsible for developing, managing and delivering our product roadmap. This individual will play a pivotal role in defining competitive market requirements as well as developing a winning go-to-market strategy that associates the roadmap with attainable growth and engagement targets.

This role is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned Product Management leader to further develop and grow Recon’s innovative product offerings. You'll be challenged to blend customer centric requirements with industry-changing innovation while paying close attention to the needs of our target market. You will also work directly with senior leaders, as well as the rest of the product team, to create experiences that reinforce the brand and create that wow factor. Additional duties include generating and documenting detailed product requirements and management of product launches.

 

Primary Responsibilities:

Assist in defining the overall product vision and strategy for our existing and future web and mobile products
Develop product positioning and messaging throughout various marketing research activities, insight into market opportunities, propose product ideas, and investigate competing products across multiple verticals
Make decisions based on market size, growth potential and well-defined competitive advantage
Define and document product requirements, user interface design and delivery goals
Contribute to the product management lifecycle including development of functional specifications and release planning
Manage and evangelize the day-to-day execution of the product roadmap, including execution of new features as well as appropriately prioritizing enhancements and bug fixes for existing features
Prioritize product opportunities to maximize engagement, growth, and ensure on-time delivery
Perform competitive analysis, attend industry conferences and events, and become knowledgeable on related product offerings.
Monitor key benchmarks, analytics, test results, ROI, and present in a meaningful way to management and stakeholders.
Write and maintain product user stories by performing business analysis and working with the other team members to understand use cases and how they translate into new features and product requirements
Investigate new technology and product opportunities.
Monitor internal processes for efficiency and validity pre & post product launch/interim release
Help bring new product requirements to the ‘ready’ state with proper documentation prior to Sprint/Iteration commitments
Act as the ‘go-to-person’ when it comes to web and mobile product release schedules and product roadmaps
 

Skills and Qualifications:

5+ years of software product management experience with a proven ability to ship mobile and web products on time and on budget
Experience with web and mobile app development including public APIs, responsive design, iOS, and Android
Understand agile software development best practices and the product management lifecycle
BA/BSc or equivalent experience; MBA preferred
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Team player with strong interpersonal skills and high level of customer service for internal and external audiences
Up-to-date on web and mobile UI/UX best practices and industry trends
Strong Market research/target market analysis
Ability to juggle multiple priorities and make things happen in a fast-paced environment
Must be an entrepreneur-at-heart who is enthusiastic, energetic and be able to work independently
Passionate about web and mobile application software industry; has a keen tech market insight
 

Bonus Points:

Knowledge of or experience with Bluetooth, Bluetooth Smart & Internet of Things (IoT)
Knowledge of the wearable, quantified self, and digital fitness space, specifically products targeting the endurance market
Love to ride, run and are familiar with popular cycling and running products
You are a tech early adopter and gadget lover
 

Life at Recon

We brainstorm, design and prototype customer-focused products. At Recon our four core values are important to us. That's why we Create with Passion, Drive to Deliver, Wow the Customer, and Play as a Team.

Life at Recon means working with awesome technology in small teams with friendly people who are passionate about their craft. We also provide ways to let go and have fun because we believe people who enjoy their workplace create great things together.  

So, what does fun look like to us? Ping-pong and foosball matches, Friday dinners, weekly happy hour, group bike rides, and company-wide events. At Recon, we care about our teams and fully embrace the west coast work-hard, play-hard mentality.

Backend/Ops Developer
description:
About Picatic
Picatic is a crowdfunding and traditional ticketing platform for the events space. Picatic empowers event organizers to create, manage and promote events of all sizes while encouraging organizers to choose their own service fees with FairPay. Our mission is to enable promoters to host successful events.

At Picatic, we strive to be a diverse and inclusive company. We value different opinions, off the wall ideas and the quirky things that make you unique.

The Job
Backend/Ops Developer

Your main roles
Work with our team to take an idea from concept to shipped.
Contribute to our existing projects and help lead new projects.
Continually help us improve our services with testing, automation and monitoring.
Be open to learning new technologies as we grow and helping others learn as well.
Core competencies you must have to apply
Open mind, checked ego and openness to diversity.
Ability to learn and share in learning.
Speaking your mind and challenging assumptions.
Working with a team to set and meet goals.
How does Picatic tick?
We are a polyglot company and try to use the right tool for the job. We find team diversity helps bring alternate ideas and approaches to light. We like to consider our options as a team and make decisions based on long term value to our customers and company. Our own mix of lean startup helps guide our decisions as a team and company.

Our current stack is a blend of PHP, NodeJS, AngularJS, Docker and various supplementary languages. We know that parts of our system are legacy, but we have open conversations about how we plan to replace them and move forward. For example: The team has been discussing the benefits of rewriting parts of our stack in Golang or a similar language.

Over the last year we have been making a transition to a “Service Orientated Architecture” which has allowed us to consider solutions we previously had not considered. A wide new range of ideas our platform can support are opening up to us, it is truly an exciting time at Picatic.

We value experience in all areas in technology/business/startup/life; but of course, it is always nice to have experience in the technologies we presently use. We encourage all applicants to apply if they feel they can contribute and are willing to learn.

We can offer
Competitive salary based on experience: $65,000 to $95,000. We offer vested stock options as well.
Flexible work hours. We meet daily (virtually or physically) for team standup at 8:30am.
Family first policy. Kids, pregancy and life’s unpredictable events come up. We understand, take the time you need to take care of what matters most.
Contemporary open office. Interact with the team in our beautiful downtown office. Kitchenette, creative rooms and a great location (next to Waterfront station).

Senior Software Developer
description:
We're looking for a Senior Software Developer to help us grow. This is a great opportunity to work with a diverse and experienced team. If you're a full stack polyglot who loves working with talented and passionate peers, then this role is for you. We're Plentyoffish Media, the world leader in online dating with over 90 million members and growing. Come join our team and become a part of a recognized and cutting-edge company!

 

So, what will you do?

Design and implement solutions to highly complex problems.
Continuously deploy test-driven code.
Build high-performance, mission-critical applications. We're small enough that you can make a real impact on what we develop.
Understand current web technologies and application structure from end-to-end.
Provide analysis, recommendations, and solutions to improve performance, security and scalability of software and services.
Share. We have a highly collaborative environment and we want you to share your expertise and help facilitate constant learning.
 

What does our ideal candidate look like?

Expert level C#, MSSQL, Javascript and web technologies
5+ years of commercial software development.
Ability to read and decipher legacy code.
Love technology and always be proactively working to stay ahead of the latest in hardware and software developments.
Experienced with security and high volume, large scale environments.
 

Bonus points for:

Python, Go, C++
PostgreSQL, Cassandra,
Linux, Docker, Puppet
Kafka, Storm
Elasticsearch, Graphite

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
We are looking for an extremely passionate, detail-oriented, and smart Linux Systems Administrator to join our team. We have over half a million users online at a time, servers with 2TB of ram , 60 cores, and a 10GB pipe to the office. If you want to work with a talented, supportive, fun team who loves tech/ops then this might be the role for you.

We're Plentyoffish Media, the world leader in online dating with over 90 million members and growing. Come join our team of driven and passionate professionals and become a part of a recognized and cutting-edge company!

So, what will you do?

In depth analysis and trouble shooting of Linux and Windows servers
Support, configure, administer, monitor our datacenter Infrastructure hardware, software, systems, network and office systems
Install/manage Linux and Windows Servers
Administer Linux clusters running NoSQL, Puppet, MaaS and other open source technologies
Monitor and escalate application issues
Conduct ongoing checks of systems/software for proper operation
Ongoing data backup, restore and testing of disaster recovery scenarios
Troubleshoot reported problems
Willingness to work in an on-call rotation to support a 24X7 environment
 

What does our ideal candidate look like?

5+ years Linux Server systems administration experience. Familiarity with Windows servers is highly desirable.
Must be strong in dealing with Linux, cluster management, open source technologies
Grasp of automation tools - Ansible, Chef, Puppet
Experience with Git version control
Have a demonstrated proficiency with a range of open source products
Hands on experience or thorough understanding of Web applications environment and networking fundamentals
Passionate about new technologies and pushing its boundaries
Organized, responsible, and able to effectively deal with multiple concurrent accountabilities
Be self-directed and able to work with minimal guidance
 

What's it like to work at POF?

We have a fun and casual culture
Awesome staff parties
Paid day off on your birthday
Our office is stocked with snacks and beverages
Great downtown location with easy access to transit
Awesome state-of-the-art office with fantastic views

title: Project Manager
description:
Plentyoffish is on the hunt for a talented Project Manager to join our growing team. This is a brand new role reporting to our Senior Technical Project Manager. As the Project Manager, you will influence products of enormous scale. We're the world leader in online dating with over 90 million members and growing. Are you passionate about chasing down deliverables? Are you organized, accountable, and able to motivate others with ease? If so, come join our team of driven and passionate professionals and become a part of a recognized and cutting-edge company.


So, what will you do?

Drive company processes, book and run effective meetings, provide regular status reports, escalate issues to stakeholders in clear and timely manner.
Be an effective partner with technical and non-technical (creative, product, CSR, QA) stakeholders. Must be able to communicate near term deliverables, blockers, risks to coordinated ship dates.
Coordinate content delivery with Product, Localization & Design to align with project schedule.
Be quick on your feet & outside the box thinker, who can thrive in a challenging environment where you will not always have every ideal bit of info available to you in order to make decisions.
 

What does our ideal candidate look like?

2+ years as a Project Manager in a large scale, revenue bearing production environment
2+ years experience in scheduling for teams of 3 or more people.
2+ years Experience as direct line manager with technical staff preferred.
2+ years experience implementing & driving cross discipline resource utilization (Gantt or similar).
High degree of managerial courage and personal integrity. Stand by your decisions and explain your reasoning for your decisions with consistency and clarity.
Experience in a large scale systems handling any combo of payment processing & information storage, security auditing, confidential user data, content distribution networks a big plus
Continuous learner who can help design & distribute data visualizations for the entire team.
Strong resource planning experience
Organized and able to lead by example, and exhibit high attention to detail. 
Superb written and verbal communication skills. Comfortable working with people much smarter than you. 
Excellent decision making skills that factors in long term upside, scalability, business relationships.
Relevant experience & general understanding of end to end delivery in terms of Infrastructure, Analytics, Billing, Localization, DB, API's, participation in full SDLC 
Highly proficient with MS Office applications, project management software, and bug tracking software.
PMP Designation is a plus
 

What's it like to work at POF?

We have a fun and casual culture.
Our office is stocked with snacks and beverages.
Great downtown location with easy access to transit.
Awesome state-of-the-art office with fantastic views.

title: Senior DBA
description:
Plentyoffish Media, the world leader in online dating with an ever-increasing 90 million members is looking for a Senior DBA to join our team.

This is a rare opportunity to work with highly experienced, driven professionals and cutting edge technology with an impressively unparalleled and challenging scale.


So, what will you do?

Create and maintain maintenance plans, performance tuning, advise programmers on improving schemas
Plan and establish technology roadmaps, product goals, and development strategies
Participate in a highly collaborative environment, we want you to share your expertise, making everyone else better and facilitating constant learning
Proactively monitor 24/7 mission critical servers

SQL Server HA (high availability)

Ubuntu Linux, Docker and Puppet 
New database installations

Backups and recovery
Database monitoring
Server and database security
Index management and optimization
Experience in developing functions and stored procedures
Capable of multi-tasking and ability to manage projects
Experience with Postgres, Cassandra is preferred
Experience in the social networking, dating, or other subscription-based business is a plus
Bonus points for SQL Server 2012/2014 experience
 

What’s it like to work at POF?

We have a fun and casual culture
Our office is stocked with snacks and beverages
Great downtown location with easy access to transit
Awesome state-of-the-art office with fantastic views

title: Full stack Intermediate Developer
description:
Crewcovery is a startup based in vancouver. We are a community based online social platform dedicated to the development of entertainment projects and ideas through raising creative talents. We are currently looking for an intermediate developer with experience in building scalable and database driven social platforms to join our team.

Our product is built on the MEAN stack, utilizing Bootstrap as our front-end framework

Responsibilities
● Contribute in all phases of the development life cycle.
● Write well designed, testable, efficient code.
● Ensure designs are in compliance with specifications.
● Prepare and produce releases of software components.
● Support continuous improvement by investigating alternatives and technologies and presenting these for architectural review.
● Understanding of modern development practices – REST, OAuth, API development, etc.

Requirements
● 3+ years of experience in JS development
●Object-oriented programming, analysis, and design using common design patterns and best practices.
● Profound insight of JavaScript and NodeJS internals including building public node (npm) modules
● Ability to quickly learn and understand complex APIs - REST, streaming, webhooks
● Experience about JavaScript, NodeJS, AngularJS, Redis and NoSQL databases like MongoDB.
● Experience with AWS deployment and hosting
● Experience with JQuery
● Experience with Software Testing / website testing

We are looking for someone who is available to work two days a week in an office located near the Stadium skytrain station.
